question_text: Which TWO characteristics describe redundant server power supplies? (Select two)
answer_options: They typically run at 100% load each
They allow power supply replacement without downtime
They support power load balancing under normal use
They reduce the need for backup generators
correct_answer: They allow power supply replacement without downtime
They support power load balancing under normal use
explanation: Redundant server power supplies are designed to split load during operation and be hot-swappable, supporting high uptime environments.
